title: Lawsuits
img_alt: Peggy Babcock's Lawsuits attract quite the crowd
body:
Perhaps even more famous than her biscuits, Peggy Babcock is renonwned for her dedication to litigation.

From quashing the workers' rights bill in Lithuania in 1993, to reducing claimants' payouts from the Peggy Babcock Alligator Park in 1982, Peggy is a fierce competitor in the court room.

With her famous ”I believe in justice for oligarchs“ saying and self-taught legal knowledge, Peggy has won fans the world over with her unusual style.
